intro: Fissistigma parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered fissistigma, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers with five petals, typically arranged in clusters at the ends of branches. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The fruit is a small, two-valved capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature.
